{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents discuss various aspects of maxillary osteotomies, including planning, execution, and follow-up care. In the document 'Complications associated with maxillary ostetomies', it is mentioned that the paramount cause of complications seems to be the interruption of the blood supply to the operative site. This implies that bleeding can occur during the procedure. Among the given options, Heparin (C) is a common anticoagulant used to prevent bleeding. Tranexamic acid (D) is also an effective medication in preventing bleeding. Acetoacetic acid and Lactic acid do not seem to be relevant or commonly used for this purpose.", "answer_choice": "CD"}
